00041 #ifndef __MMDB_SelMngr__
00042 #define __MMDB_SelMngr__

00045 #include "mmdb_mask.h"

00047 namespace mmdb  {
00048 
00049   // =======================   SelManager  ==========================
00050 
00051   //   Selection keys. These specify how the requested selection
00052   // operation applies to the existing selection for the given mask:
00053   //    SKEY_NEW    previous selection is wiped out
00054   //    SKEY_OR     new selection is added to the already selected set;
00055   //                if no selection preexists, SKEY_NEW and SKEY_OR
00056   //                are equivalent. This key is the default one in
00057   //                all selection functions.
00058   //    SKEY_AND    new selection is made on the already selected set;
00059   //                this corresponds to logical 'and' of former and
00060   //                current selections. If no selection preexists,
00061   //                no selection will be made.
00062   //    SKEY_XOR    only those atoms will be left which are found
00063   //                in either former or newly selected sets, but not
00064   //                in both of them; this corresponds to logical
00065   //                'exclusive or' of previous and current selections.
00066   //                If no selection preexists, it is equivalent to
00067   //                SKEY_OR.
00068   enum SELECTION_KEY  {
00069     SKEY_NEW  = 0,
00070     SKEY_OR   = 1,
00071     SKEY_AND  = 2,
00072     SKEY_XOR  = 3,
00073     SKEY_CLR  = 4,
00074     SKEY_XAND = 100  // used internally
00075   };
00076 
00077   //  Selection types
00078   enum SELECTION_TYPE  {
00079     STYPE_INVALID   = -1,
00080     STYPE_UNDEFINED =  0,
00081     STYPE_ATOM      =  1,
00082     STYPE_RESIDUE   =  2,
00083     STYPE_CHAIN     =  3,
00084     STYPE_MODEL     =  4
00085   };
00086 
00087   //  Residue properties for SelectProperties()
00088   enum SELECTION_PROPERTY  {
00089     SELPROP_Solvent    = 0,
00090     SELPROP_Aminoacid  = 1,
00091     SELPROP_Nucleotide = 2,
00092     SELPROP_Sugar      = 3,
00093     SELPROP_ModRes     = 4
00094   };
00095 
00096   //  comparison rules for SelectUDD function
00097   enum UDD_CMP_RULE  {
00098     UDSCR_LT        =  1,
00099     UDSCR_LE        =  2,
00100     UDSCR_EQ        =  3,
00101     UDSCR_NE        =  4,
00102     UDSCR_GE        =  5,
00103     UDSCR_GT        =  6,
00104     UDSCR_LTcase    =  7,
00105     UDSCR_LEcase    =  8,
00106     UDSCR_EQcase    =  9,
00107     UDSCR_NEcase    = 10,
00108     UDSCR_GEcase    = 11,
00109     UDSCR_GTcase    = 12,
00110     UDSCR_LTn       = 13,
00111     UDSCR_LEn       = 14,
00112     UDSCR_EQn       = 15,
00113     UDSCR_NEn       = 16,
00114     UDSCR_GEn       = 17,
00115     UDSCR_GTn       = 18,
00116     UDSCR_LTncase   = 19,
00117     UDSCR_LEncase   = 20,
00118     UDSCR_EQncase   = 21,
00119     UDSCR_NEncase   = 22,
00120     UDSCR_GEncase   = 23,
00121     UDSCR_GTncase   = 24,
00122     UDSCR_Substr    = 25,
00123     UDSCR_NoSubstr  = 26,
00124     UDSCR_Substr1   = 27,
00125     UDSCR_NoSubstr1 = 28
00126   };
00127 
00128   DefineClass(SelManager);
00129   DefineStreamFunctions(SelManager);

00131   class  SelManager : public  CoorManager  {
00132 
00133     public :
00134 
00135        SelManager ();
00136        SelManager ( io::RPStream Object );
00137       ~ SelManager();

00139 
00140       // ====================  Selecting atoms  =======================
00141 
00142       //    NewSelection() creates a new selection mask and returns its
00143       // handle.  A handle is always a positive (non-zero) integer.
00144       // Calling NewSelection() is the only way to create a new
00145       // selection mask. Notice however that masks will be automatically
00146       // copied from another MMDB (see Copy(..) in CMMDBManager) if
00147       // coordinates are copied; if this is the case, the mask handles
00148       // will be inherited from the source MMDB as well. The masks will
00149       // also be automatically deleted (see Delete(..) in CMMDBManager())
00150       // if coordinates are deleted.
00151       int   NewSelection ();
00152 
00153       int   GetSelType ( int selHnd );  // returns STYPE_XXXX
00154 
00155       //    DeleteSelection(..) deletes the specified selection mask
00156       // and removes the corresponding selection attributes from
00157       // all atoms, which were selected with this mask. If an atom
00158       // was selected also with other mask(s), the other selection(s)
00159       // will remain, provided that the corresponding masks are valid.
00160       // After DeleteSelection() returns, the corresponding mask
00161       // becomes invalid.
00162       void  DeleteSelection ( int selHnd );
00163 
00164       //    DeleteAllSelections() deletes all selection masks and
00165       // unselects all atoms in the file. All mask handles become
00166       // invalid.
00167       void  DeleteAllSelections();
00168 
00169       //   SelectAtoms(..) selects atoms in the serial number range
00170       // of iSer1 to iSer2 by adding them to the set of atoms
00171       // marked by the given mask. If iSer1=iSer2=0 then all atoms
00172       // are selected. Each atom may be selected by a number of masks
00173       // simultaneously.
00174       void  SelectAtoms ( int selHnd, int iSer1, int iSer2,
00175                           SELECTION_KEY selKey=SKEY_OR // selection key
00176                         );
00177 
00178       //   SelectAtoms(..) selects atoms with serial numbers given in
00179       // vector asn[0..nsn-1].
00180       void  SelectAtoms ( int selHnd, ivector asn, int nsn,
00181                           SELECTION_KEY selKey=SKEY_OR // selection key
00182                         );
00183 
00184       //   UnselectAtoms(..) clears the specified mask for atoms in
00185       // the serial number range of iSer1 to iSer2. If iSer1=iSer2=0
00186       // then all atoms are cleared of the specified mask. If selHnd
00187       // is set to 0, then the atoms are cleared of any mask.
00188       void  UnselectAtoms ( int selHnd, int iSer1, int iSer2 );
00189 
00190       //   SelectAtom(..) selects a single atom according to the value
00191       // of selection key. If makeIndex is false, then the routine
00192       // does not update the selection index. This saves time, but
00193       // prevents GetSelIndex(..) from accessing all selected atoms.
00194       // In order to update the index after all single-atom selections
00195       // are done, use MakeSelIndex(selHnd) found next.
00196       void  SelectAtom    ( int selHnd, PAtom A,
00197                             SELECTION_KEY selKey=SKEY_OR,
00198                             bool makeIndex=true );
00199 
00200       //   SelectResidue(..), SelectChain(..) and SelectModel(..)
00201       // select a single residue, chain or model, or all their
00202       // hierarchical descendants depending on the value of sType
00203       // (i.e. atoms, residues (in chain and model) and chains
00204       // (in model only). Ascending hierarchical objects should be
00205       // selected explicitely, e.g. atom->GetResidue()->SelectResidue(..)
00206       void  SelectResidue ( int selHnd, PResidue Res,
00207                             SELECTION_TYPE sType,
00208                             SELECTION_KEY  sKey,
00209                             bool makeIndex );
00210       void  SelectChain   ( int selHnd, PChain chain,
00211                             SELECTION_TYPE sType,
00212                             SELECTION_KEY  sKey,
00213                             bool makeIndex );
00214       void  SelectModel   ( int selHnd, PModel mdl,
00215                             SELECTION_TYPE sType,
00216                             SELECTION_KEY  sKey,
00217                             bool makeIndex );
00218 
00219 
00220       //   MakeSelIndex(.) calculates selection index for selection
00221       // adressed by selHnd.  All selection functions except the
00222       // SelectAtom(..) above, update selection index automatically.
00223       // This function is for use after a series of calls to
00224       // SelectAtom(..) with makeIndex parameter set false. This
00225       // combination of SelectAtom - MakeSelIndex considerably saves CPU
00226       // at extensive selections.
00227       //   MakeSelIndex(.) returns the number of selected objects.
00228       int   MakeSelIndex  ( int selHnd );
00229       void  MakeAllSelIndexes();
00230 
00231       //   Selecting by atom ID, space condition (a sphere) and some
00232       // other bits.
00233       void  SelectAtoms (
00234                int   selHnd,   // must be obtained from NewSelection()
00235                int   iModel,   // model number; iModel=0 means
00236                                // 'any model'
00237                cpstr Chains,   // may be several chains "A,B,W"; "*"
00238                                // means 'any chain' (in selected
00239                                // model(s))
00240                int   ResNo1,   // starting residue sequence number
00241                cpstr Ins1,     // starting residue insertion code; "*"
00242                                // means 'any code'
00243                int   ResNo2,   // ending residue sequence number.
00244                cpstr Ins2,     // ending residue insertion code; "*"
00245                                // means 'any code'. Combination of
00246                                // ResNo1=ResNo2=ANY_RES and
00247                                // Ins1=Ins2="*" means 'any residue'
00248                                // (in selected chain(s))
00249                cpstr RNames,   // may be several residue names
00250                                // "ALA,GLU,CIS"; "*" means 'any
00251                                // residue name'
00252                cpstr ANames,   // may be several names "CA,CB"; "*"
00253                                // means 'any atom' (in selected
00254                                // residue(s))
00255                cpstr Elements, // may be several element types
00256                                // 'H,C,O,CU'; "*" means 'any element'
00257                cpstr altLocs,  // may be several alternative
00258                                // locations 'A,B'; "*" means
00259                                // 'any alternative location'
00260                cpstr Segments, // may be several segment IDs
00261                                // like "S1,S2,A234"; "*" means
00262                                // 'any segment'
00263                cpstr Charges,  // may be several charges like
00264                                // "+1,-2,  "; "*" means 'any charge'
00265                realtype occ1,  // lowest occupancy
00266                realtype occ2,  // highest occupancy; occ1=occ2<0.0
00267                                // means "any occupancy"
00268                realtype x0,    // reference x-point
00269                realtype y0,    // reference y-point
00270                realtype z0,    // reference z-point
00271                realtype d0,    // selection distance from the
00272                                // reference point; d0<=0.0
00273                                // means "any distance" and values
00274                                // of x0, y0 and z0 are ignored
00275                SELECTION_KEY selKey=SKEY_OR // selection key
00276              );
00277 
00278       //  Selecting by just atom ID, no other conditions
00279       void  SelectAtoms (
00280                int   selHnd,   // must be obtained from NewSelection()
00281                int   iModel,   // model number; iModel=0 means
00282                                // 'any model'
00283                cpstr Chains,   // may be several chains "A,B,W"; "*"
00284                                // means 'any chain' (in selected
00285                                // model(s))
00286                int   ResNo1,   // starting residue sequence number
00287                cpstr Ins1,     // starting residue insertion code; "*"
00288                                // means 'any code'
00289                int   ResNo2,   // ending residue sequence number.
00290                cpstr Ins2,     // ending residue insertion code; "*"
00291                                // means 'any code'. Combination of
00292                                // ResNo1=ResNo2=ANY_RES and
00293                                // Ins1=Ins2="*" means 'any residue
00294                                // number' (in selected chain(s))
00295                cpstr RNames,   // may be several residue names
00296                                // "ALA,GLU,CIS"; "*" means 'any
00297                                // residue name'
00298                cpstr ANames,   // may be several names "CA,CB"; "*"
00299                                // means 'any atom' (in selected
00300                                // residue(s))
00301                cpstr Elements, // may be several element types
00302                                // "H,C,O,CU"; "*" means 'any element'
00303                cpstr altLocs,  // may be several alternative
00304                                // locations 'A,B'; "*" means
00305                                // 'any alternative location'
00306                SELECTION_KEY selKey=SKEY_OR // selection key
00307              );
00308 
00309 
00310       //  Selecting by integer User-Defined Data
00311       void  SelectUDD (
00312                int      selHnd, // must be obtained from NewSelection()
00313                SELECTION_TYPE sType, // selection type STYPE_XXXXX
00314                int   UDDhandle, // UDD handle
00315                int      selMin, // lower selection boundary
00316                int      selMax, // upper selection boundary
00317                SELECTION_KEY  sKey  // selection key
00318              );
00319       void  SelectUDD (
00320                int      selHnd, // must be obtained from NewSelection()
00321                SELECTION_TYPE sType, // selection type STYPE_XXXXX
00322                int   UDDhandle, // UDD handle
00323                realtype selMin, // lower selection boundary
00324                realtype selMax, // upper selection boundary
00325                SELECTION_KEY  sKey  // selection key
00326              );
00327       void  SelectUDD (
00328                int        selHnd, // must be obtained from NewSelection()
00329                SELECTION_TYPE  sType, // selection type STYPE_XXXXX
00330                int     UDDhandle, // UDD handle
00331                cpstr      selStr, // selection string
00332                int       cmpRule, // comparison rule
00333                SELECTION_KEY   sKey  // selection key
00334              );
00335 
00336 
00337       //  Selecting a sphere
00338       void  SelectSphere (
00339                int  selHnd, // must be obtained from NewSelection()
00340                SELECTION_TYPE sType, // selection type STYPE_XXXXX
00341                realtype  x, // x-coordinate of the sphere's center
00342                realtype  y, // y-coordinate of the sphere's center
00343                realtype  z, // z-coordinate of the sphere's center
00344                realtype  r, // radius of the sphere
00345                SELECTION_KEY  sKey=SKEY_OR // selection key
00346              );
00347 
00348       //  Selecting a cylinder
00349       void  SelectCylinder (
00350                int  selHnd, // must be obtained from NewSelection()
00351                SELECTION_TYPE sType, // selection type STYPE_XXXXX
00352                realtype x1, // x-coordinate of the cylinder axis' 1st end
00353                realtype y1, // y-coordinate of the cylinder axis' 1st end
00354                realtype z1, // z-coordinate of the cylinder axis' 1st end
00355                realtype x2, // x-coordinate of the cylinder axis' 2nd end
00356                realtype y2, // y-coordinate of the cylinder axis' 2nd end
00357                realtype z2, // z-coordinate of the cylinder axis' 2nd end
00358                realtype  r, // radius of the cylinder
00359                SELECTION_KEY  sKey=SKEY_OR // selection key
00360              );
00361 
00362       //  Selecting all atoms on a given distance from a plane
00363       void  SelectSlab (
00364                int  selHnd, // must be obtained from NewSelection()
00365                SELECTION_TYPE sType, // selection type STYPE_XXXXX
00366                realtype  a, // a-parameter of the plane  ax+by+cz=d
00367                realtype  b, // b-parameter of the plane  ax+by+cz=d
00368                realtype  c, // c-parameter of the plane  ax+by+cz=d
00369                realtype  d, // d-parameter of the plane  ax+by+cz=d
00370                realtype  r, // distance to the plane
00371                SELECTION_KEY  sKey=SKEY_OR  // selection key
00372              );
00373 
00374       //  Selecting all atoms on a given distance from already selected
00375       void  SelectNeighbours (
00376                int      selHnd, // must be obtained from NewSelection()
00377                SELECTION_TYPE sType, // selection type STYPE_XXXXX
00378                PPAtom   sA,   // array of already selected atoms
00379                int      alen, // length of A
00380                realtype d1,   // minimal distance to already selected atoms
00381                realtype d2,   // maximal distance to already selected atoms
00382                SELECTION_KEY  sKey=SKEY_OR // selection key
00383              );

00391                PPAtom & SelAtom,  // continuous index of selected
00392                                   // atoms; application must not
00393                                   // dispose either index or atoms
00394                int &    nSelAtoms // length of index
00395                                   // [0..nSelectedAtoms-1]
00396              );
00397

00399       void  GetSelIndex (

00402                                         // residues; application must
00403                                         // not dispose either index or
00404                                         // residues
00405                int &       nSelResidues // length of index
00406                                         // [0..nSelResidues-1]
00407              );
00408

00410       void  GetSelIndex (

00412                PPChain & SelChains, // continuous index of selected
00413                                     // chains; application must not
00414                                     // dispose either index or chains
00415                int &     nSelChains // length of index
00416                                     // [0..nSelChains-1]
00417              );

00422                PPModel & SelModels, // continuous index of selected
00423                                     // models; application must not
00424                                     // dispose either index or models
00425                int &     nSelModels // length of index
00426                                     // [0..nSelModels-1]
00427              );

00432       // ===============  General selection functions  ================
00433 
00434       //   Selecting by atom ID, space condition (a sphere) and some
00435       // other bits.
00436       void  Select (
00437                int   selHnd,   // must be obtained from NewSelection()
00438                SELECTION_TYPE sType,  // selection type STYPE_XXXXX
00439                int   iModel,   // model number; iModel=0 means
00440                                // 'any model'
00441                cpstr Chains,   // may be several chains "A,B,W"; "*"
00442                                // means 'any chain' (in selected
00443                                // model(s))
00444                int   ResNo1,   // starting residue sequence number
00445                cpstr Ins1,     // starting residue insertion code; "*"
00446                                // means 'any code'
00447                int   ResNo2,   // ending residue sequence number.
00448                cpstr Ins2,     // ending residue insertion code; "*"
00449                                // means 'any code'. Combination of
00450                                // ResNo1=ResNo2=ANY_RES and
00451                                // Ins1=Ins2="*" means 'any residue'
00452                                // (in selected chain(s))
00453                cpstr RNames,   // may be several residue names
00454                                // "ALA,GLU,CIS"; "*" means
00455                                // 'any residue name'
00456                cpstr ANames,   // may be several names "CA,CB"; "*"
00457                                // means 'any atom' (in selected
00458                                // residue(s))
00459                cpstr Elements, // may be several element types
00460                                // 'H,C,O,CU'; "*" means 'any element'
00461                cpstr altLocs,  // may be several alternative
00462                                // locations 'A,B'; "*" means
00463                                // 'any alternative location'
00464                cpstr Segments, // may be several segment IDs like
00465                                // "S1,S2,A234"; "*" means
00466                                // 'any segment'
00467                cpstr Charges,  // may be several charges like
00468                                // "+1,-2,  "; "*" means 'any charge'
00469                realtype occ1,  // lowest occupancy
00470                realtype occ2,  // highest occupancy; occ1=occ2<0.0
00471                                // means "any occupancy"
00472                realtype x0,    // reference x-point
00473                realtype y0,    // reference y-point
00474                realtype z0,    // reference z-point
00475                realtype d0,    // selection distance from the
00476                                // reference point; d0<=0.0
00477                                // means "any distance" and values
00478                                // of x0, y0 and z0 are ignored
00479                SELECTION_KEY sKey=SKEY_OR // selection key
00480              );
00481

00483       //  Selecting by just atom ID, no other conditions
00484       void  Select (
00485                int   selHnd,   // must be obtained from NewSelection()
00486                SELECTION_TYPE sType,  // selection type STYPE_XXXXX
00487                int   iModel,   // model number; iModel=0 means
00488                                // 'any model'
00489                cpstr Chains,   // may be several chains "A,B,W"; "*"
00490                                // means 'any chain' (in selected
00491                                // model(s))
00492                int   ResNo1,   // starting residue sequence number
00493                cpstr Ins1,     // starting residue insertion code; "*"
00494                                // means 'any code'
00495                int   ResNo2,   // ending residue sequence number.
00496                cpstr Ins2,     // ending residue insertion code; "*"
00497                                // means 'any code'. Combination of
00498                                // ResNo1=ResNo2=ANY_RES and
00499                                // Ins1=Ins2="*" means 'any residue
00500                                // number' (in selected chain(s))
00501                cpstr RNames,   // may be several residue names
00502                                // "ALA,GLU,CIS"; "*" means
00503                                // 'any residue name'
00504                cpstr ANames,   // may be several names "CA,CB"; "*"
00505                                // means 'any atom' (in selected
00506                                // residue(s))
00507                cpstr Elements, // may be several element types
00508                                // "H,C,O,CU"; "*" means 'any element'
00509                cpstr altLocs,  // may be several alternative
00510                                // locations 'A,B'; "*" means
00511                                // 'any alternative location'
00512                SELECTION_KEY sKey=SKEY_OR // selection key
00513              );

00515 
00516       //  Selecting by coordinate ID.
00517       //  Examples:
00518       //
00519       //  1.  /mdl/chn/s1.i1-s2.i2/at[el]:aloc
00520       //  2.  /mdl/chn/*(res).ic  /at[el]:aloc
00521       //  3.       chn/*(res).ic  /at[el]:aloc
00522       //  4.           s1.i1-s2.i2/at[el]:aloc
00523       //  5.           s1.i1      /at[el]:aloc
00524       //  6.  /mdl
00525       //  7.       chn
00526       //  8.           s1.i1-s2.i2
00527       //  9.           (res)
00528       //  10.                      at[el]:aloc
00529       //  11.      chn//[el]
00530       //
00531       //  mdl   - the model's serial number or 0 or '*' for any model
00532       //          (default).
00533       //  chn   - the chain ID or list of chains 'A,B,C' or '*' for
00534       //          any chain (default).
00535       //  s1,s2 - the starting and ending residue sequence numbers
00536       //          or '*' for any sequence number (default).
00537       //  i1,i2 - the residues insertion codes or '*' for any
00538       //          insertion code. If the sequence number other than
00539       //          '*' is specified, then insertion code defaults to ""
00540       //          (no insertion code), otherwise the default is '*'.
00541       //  at    - atom name or list of atom names 'CA,N1,O' or '*'
00542       //          for any atom name (default)
00543       //  el    - chemical element name or list of chemical element
00544       //          names 'C,N,O' or '*' for any chemical element name
00545       //          (default)
00546       //  aloc  - the alternative location indicator or '*' for any
00547       //          alternate location. If the atom name and chemical
00548       //          element name is specified (both may be '*'), then
00549       //          the alternative location indicator defaults to ""
00550       //          (no alternate location), otherwise the default is
00551       //           '*'.
00552       //
00553       //  All spaces are ignored.
00554       //
00555       //  Returns -1 if numerical format of model is wrong, -2 if
00556       //  numerical format for sequence number is wrong, and 0
00557       //  otherwise.
00558 
00559       int   Select (
00560                int   selHnd,    // must be obtained from NewSelection()
00561                SELECTION_TYPE sType, // selection type STYPE_XXXXX
00562                cpstr CID,       // coordinate ID
00563                SELECTION_KEY  sKey   // selection key
00564              );
00565 
00566       //  Propagating the selection up and down coordinate hierarchy
00567       void  Select (
00568                int  selHnd1,  // must be obtained from NewSelection()
00569                SELECTION_TYPE sType,  // selection type STYPE_XXXXX
00570                int  selHnd2,  // must be obtained from NewSelection()
00571                               // and have been used for selection
00572                SELECTION_KEY  sKey=SKEY_OR // selection key
00573              );
00574 
00575       void  SelectProperty (
00576                int  selHnd,   // must be obtained from NewSelection()
00577                SELECTION_PROPERTY propKey, // property key SELPROP_XXXXXXX
00578                SELECTION_TYPE     sType, // selection type STYPE_XXXXX
00579                SELECTION_KEY      sKey   // selection key
00580              );
00581 
00582       // In SelectDomain, domainRange is of the following format:
00583       //    "*", "(all)"            - take all file
00584       //    "-"                     - take chain without chain ID
00585       //    "a:Ni-Mj,b:Kp-Lq,..."   - take chain a residue number N
00586       //                             insertion code i to residue numberM
00587       //                             insertion code j plus chain b
00588       //                             residue number K insertion code p to
00589       //                             residue number L insertion code q
00590       //                             and so on.
00591       //    "a:,b:..."              - take whole chains a and b and so on
00592       //    "a:,b:Kp-Lq,..."        - any combination of the above.
00593       int  SelectDomain ( int selHnd , cpstr domainRange,
00594                           SELECTION_TYPE sType,
00595                           SELECTION_KEY  sKey,
00596                           int modelNo=1 );
00597 
00598       void  DeleteSelObjects ( int selHnd );
00599

00607       ivector   nSelItems;     // numbers of selected items
